Incident Management
What's Incident Management?
Set Up
Identify an Incident
Start a Swarm
Track an Incident
Diagnose the Problem
Share Incident Updates

To help your team share updates with customers at scale during an incident, set up Broadcast Communications.

Set Up Broadcast Site Banners
Enable broadcast site banners, create a broadcast topic, and assign it to a network site. Add the Site Banner component to Experience Builder.
Set Up Broadcast Emails
Enable broadcast emails, manage or create a contact list view, or let users send a broadcast email to case or product contacts related to an incident.
Set Up Broadcast Alerts
Enable broadcast alerts, create a broadcast topic, and assign it to a group. Add the Incident Alerts widget to your console if using a custom Lightning console app.
Set Up Broadcast Slack Messages
Set up Service Cloud for Slack app, enable broadcast Slack messages, create a broadcast topic, and assign it to a Slack channel.

Give Users Access to Broadcast Communications
Let users create different broadcast types by giving them access to Broadcast Communications object permissions.
Add Broadcast Communications to Incident Record
Add the Broadcast Communications related list to the Incident page layout so users can create broadcasts when an incident occurs.

Considerations for Broadcast Communications
Keep in mind these considerations as you use different broadcast types:
Resolve an Incident
Deflect Cases with Self-Service
Add Service Cloud Channels
Set Up Routing and Rules
Build AI Solutions with Einstein for Service
Track Service Metrics and Manage Your Team
Send Surveys with Feedback Management
Deliver Field Service
Provide Ethical Customer Service
title: Setting Up Broadcast Communications in Service Cloud
